qas.question: What is the traditional date of the establishment of the Swiss Confederation?
What year did Switzerland join the United Nations?
What country is the birthplace of the Red Cross?
In what year was Switzerland last involved in a war internationally?
What Swiss holiday is celebrated on August 1st every year?

context: The establishment of the Swiss Confederation is traditionally dated to <a0_0>1 August 1291<a0_0/>, which is celebrated annually as the <a4_0>Swiss National Day<a4_0/>. The country has a long history of armed neutrality—it has not been in a state of war internationally since <a3_0>1815<a3_0/>—and did not join the United Nations until <a1_0>2002<a1_0/>. Nevertheless, it pursues an active foreign policy and is frequently involved in peace-building processes around the world. In addition to being the birthplace of the Red Cross, <a2_0>Switzerland<a2_0/> is home to numerous international organizations, including the second largest UN office. On the European level, it is a founding member of the European Free Trade Association, but notably it is not part of the European Union, nor the European Economic Area. However the country does participate in the Schengen Area and the EU's single market through a number of bilateral treaties.
